abstracts.cdata!:
The Credit and Marketing Reform Project
            is designed to support several of the policy changes needed
            in Brazil's program of structural adjustment.  Its
            primary objectives will be to support the process of making
            the agricultural credit system more market-oriented and of
            reducing rural credit subsidies, and to bring about a reform
            in trade and pricing policy for key agricultural
            commodities.  To meet these objectives, the project will
            support important changes in Government policies affecting
            interest rates on official rural credit; trade and price
            controls; risk management and financing for holders of
            agricultural stocks; and market information systems.  The
            loan will be disbursed in two tranches. All of the first
            tranche and US$100 million of the second tranche will be
            used to finance general imports.  Of the balance of US$100
            million, US$75 million will be used to fund a new
            dollar-denominated line of credit devoted to providing
            much-needed finance for commodities held for the domestic
            market. The other US$25 million will be made available to
            finance equipment and technical assistance for the
            development of new marketing instruments and a continued
            program of agricultural policy studies.
